Text: Kuhhh...chhh...

(His minimalistic use of magic itself displays how
adept he is at wielding it.)

(Although he may not have Epsilon's level of
precision, he's precise enough to respond flawlessly
to my attacks.)
Hahhh!
Shh...!
(He doesn't attempt to dodge my attacks.)

(Which means they are too fast for him to avoid... I
have him beat when it comes to ability.)
(But how do I break his intricate magic defense?)
Shhh...!
Ack!
Chhhh...kuhhh...

(He doesn't go on the offensive! He maintains a
defensive stance while looking for an opening.)

(This makes it difficult for me to find an opening in
his stance.)

(Should I give Epsilon and Zeta the signal, bide my
time, and wait for them to show up?)

(...Hold on, he could be the one that's buying time
right now.)

(If multiple enemy paladins of his level were to show
up now...)
Take this!
...Kuhhh...chhhh...

(I'll have to break his magic defense in a quick,
decisive battle.)

(But how?! How can I deliver the killing blow with
more power than I currently possess?)
(Master Shadow...!)

(Master Shadow... That's right. What would he do in
this situation?!)
...Guess that'll do it.
Wow! That's amazing!

It's much more stylish and cooler than a gun! How did
you do it?

The principle itself is simple. Cut slime into
thumb-sized pieces, roll them up, and imbue them with
magic...
Then aim like thisâ€”and release!

Whoa...! Such tremendous magic, Master
Shadow!
Tsk tsk tsk. That's not it, Beta.
It's not...?
True, I do have tremendous amounts of magic.

But the theory behind it is thisâ€”by focusing my magic
on a "point," I amplify the piercing power of my attack.
A "point"?

As a rule, magic defenses are deployed as a "surface."
This way, dark knights protect themselves from their
opponent's slashes.

But if you know where the attack will land on your
body...you can more accurately defend yourself
using a "point" rather than a "surface."

As for when attacking, it's not the entire blade's
"surface" but the blade's "point" and the several
"points" along its edge that transmit the recoil
and cut your opponent.

In other words, the more you focus on a "point" to
channel your magic, the more piercing power your
attack will have.

Amplify piercing power using a "point," not a
"surface"!
...I can't believe I remembered it now!

I really am the hero of my story...and he is the
one...I always want to be watching!
Kuhhh...chhhh...

(If this paladin is blocking my attacks using
"points" for his skillful magic defense...)
(Then I'll counter it...with my own "point"!)

(I will focus all my magic to a single "point," even
my magic diverted to defense...and I will finish him
with a single blow!)
...Kuhhh...chhhh...!

(He's going on the defensive...no, it looks like he's
aiming to counter.)

(But he will never release another attack...ever
again!)
Die!
Gahh...hahhh...?!
Whew...
I-I did it... That was close!
Beta!
Zeta...where's Epsilon?

She'll meet up with us soon along with the possessed
she cured. Couldn't find any promising intel, but at
least the rescue mission was a success.

I detected a large surge of magic, so I came
back first. Is that...a paladin?

It would appear so, but I'll need to investigate
further. But not your standard Cult member,
judging from his combat abilities.

Unfortunately, I couldn't get any intel out of him,
being that he was a bit of a handful to deal with.

...That was what took place in the Lindwurm
underground facility.

As for the mysterious paladin...future investigations
may reveal the existence of another organization
separate from the Cult of Diablos.
Oh?

(Beta's the type to elaborate on the scenarios I
invent. She's always loved listening to stories
and coming up with her own.)

(The Shadow Garden, the Cult of Diablos, and the
foreshadowing of a mysterious third force...
Yup, a classic twist.)

(Well, I'm sure it's a completely new idea for her,
and if she's excited about it, no need to rain on
her parade.)

Regardless, the paladin would have killed me on the spot
if it hadn't been for your teachings, Master Shadow!

Heh... It seems my Shadow Wisdom has granted you
nine lives.
Indeed, Master Shadow!
(Man, Beta really knows how to hype me up!)

(Well, I've got no idea...if focusing magic on a
"point" is a new idea in this world.)

(Of course, I won't tell her I got the idea from a
scene in an anime I watched in my previous life,
where a barrier is activated utilizing a "point.")

By the way, Beta, were you able to meet the
deadline for the job Alpha assigned to you?
Huh?!

O-Oh, that...well, um, more or less...! It's an
ongoing job of sorts...?!
What're you so embarrassed about?
A-Ahaha...

Well, I promise I'll tell you about it once I keep it
up a little longer!
Sure...well, just if you feel like it.
